summary: This is an internal FBI/Sentinel communication from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, concurring with and documenting the return of evidence item 1844 to Michael Thomas via his lawyer Shannon Farrar on August 28, 2019, as part of case 90A-NY-3151227.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: He is the owner of evidence item 1844 that was returned to his lawyer by the AUSA as part of FBI case 90A-NY-3151227.

persons.name: Shannon Farrar
persons.context: She is identified as the lawyer for Michael Thomas, to whom evidence item 1844 was returned on August 28, 2019.

connections.description: Shannon Farrar is identified as the lawyer representing Michael Thomas, as she received his returned evidence.

events.title: Return of evidence to Michael Thomas
events.description: Evidence item 1844, belonging to Michael Thomas, was returned to his lawyer, Shannon Farrar, as documented in Serial 68 of file 90A-NY-3151227.

events.title: AUSA concurrence recorded
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York formally concurred with the return of evidence and recorded the action in the Sentinel case system.

keyFacts: An Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York concurred with the return of specific evidence (item 1844) in FBI case 90A-NY-3151227.
The evidence belonged to an individual named Michael Thomas and was returned to his lawyer, Shannon Farrar, on August 28, 2019.
The action was documented in Serial 68 of the same FBI case file, indicating a formal evidence handling procedure.
The communication is dated September 4, 2019, and is classified as UNCLASSIFIED, showing it is part of routine case administration.
